content.text:
# Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series__disambig_1

|caption=The 2024 recipient: Hiroyuki Sanada|image=Hiroyuki Sanada 20240220.jpg}}
The Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series is an award given by the Screen Actors Guild to honor the finest acting achievements in dramatic television.
Dennis Franz holds the record for most nominations with 8. Actors who have won this award the most times are James Gandolfini playing Tony Soprano in The Sopranos and Jason Bateman playing Marty Bryde in Ozark, each having won thrice. Eight actors have won twice in this category: Steve Buscemi, Bryan Cranston, Anthony Edwards, Dennis Franz, Hugh Laurie, Martin Sheen, Kevin Spacey, and Kiefer Sutherland.
Winners and nominees
won twice for NYPD Blue (1994, 1996)]]
won twice for ER (1995, 1997)]]
won for Law & Order (1998)]]
won thrice for playing Tony Soprano in The Sopranos (1999, 2002, and 2007)]]
won two for playing Josiah Bartlett in The West Wing (2000, 2001)]]
won for 24 (2003)]]
won for House (2006)]]
for Dexter (2009)]]
won twice for playing Nucky Thompson in Boardwalk Empire (2010, 2011)]]
won twice for playing Walter White in Breaking Bad (2012, 2013)]]
won twice for playing Francis Underwood in House of Cards (2014, 2015)]]
won for playing Winston Churchill in The Crown (2016)]]
won for This Is Us (2017)]]
won for Game of Thrones (2019).]]
won thrice for his role in Ozark (2018, 2020, and 2022)]]
won for Squid Game (2021)]]
won for The Last of Us (2023)]]
won for Shōgun (2024).]]
